duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop deep expertise in assigned Salesforce modules, including learning existing architecture, integrations, and automation to be able to support, maintain, and enhance the system.
Become an expert in business processes to develop and improve Salesforce-powered solutions.
Build and maintain custom applications on the SFDC platform, including data models, business logic, user interface, and workflows.
Perform administrator functions such as user management, profiles, roles, permissions, validation rules, assignment rules, queues, licenses, capacity, and storage management.
Provide production support, troubleshooting, and testing of new functionality and SFDC seasonal releases.
Prepare data files and upload the data to Salesforce.com using data loader and other 3rd party tools. Create reports in SFDC to meet operational requirements.
Execute Change Management process, including maintaining updated documentation and data dictionary. Complete regular system audits and preparations for upgrades.
Stay current with new features and functionality to provide technical guidance and feasibility for system enhancements.
Work on customer and employee facing applications as we build the next wave of technologies that will drive our resident experience to the next level.

Perform testing of new functionality and SFDC seasonal releases. Create reports in SFDC to meet operational requirements including maintaining a standard set of queries/reports to satisfy requirements; validate queries/reports created by others in the organization and assist in the interpretation of data.

education_certification.credential: At least 6+ years’ experience administering and configuring SFDC environment with deep knowledge of the declarative (point and click) capabilities or comparable experience as a “Super User” or “Product Owner” of similar Salesforce functionality. Salesforce Certified Administrator Salesforce Certified Advanced Administrator Platform App Builder Certification
